org.cpp4j.java
Class FormattedStringBuilder

java.lang.Object
  org.cpp4j.java.FormattedStringBuilder

public class FormattedStringBuilder
extends java.lang.Object

This is a convenience class with various improvements to StringBuilder.

It provides for example append() and appendln(), both with varargs. The latter is using the platform specific line break characters from System.getProperty("line.separator").

This class also provides a convenience method fill(int, char) to append a number of characters to an existing buffer.

Most methods also return the updated instance in order to allow chaining of commands, e.g. buf.append("123.5435").pad(10);

Special version of append() and appendln() have been added, which take Throwables as argument, allowing easy printing of exceptions.

Author:
Tilmann Zaeschke

appendRightAligned

public FormattedStringBuilder appendRightAligned(java.lang.String s,
                                                 int alignPosition)
Appends to the line the white spaces and then the string s so that the end of the string s is at the position alignPosition. If the string is longer than the free space in the buffer to the align position then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

Parameters:
s - String to append.
alignPosition - index of the last character of the string relative to the current line in the buffer.
Returns:
The updated instance of FormattedStringBuilder.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if not enough space is allocated for the string.

fill

public FormattedStringBuilder fill(int newLength,
                                   char c)
Attempts to append c until the current line gets the length newLength. If the line is already as long or longer than newLength, then nothing is appended.

Parameters:
newLength - Minimal new length of the last line.
c - Character to append.
Returns:
The updated instance of FormattedStringBuilder.

fill

public FormattedStringBuilder fill(int newLength)
Attempts to append white spaces until the current line gets the length newLength. If the line is already as long or longer than newLength, then nothing is appended.

Parameters:
newLength - Minimal new length of the last line.
Returns:
The updated instance of FormattedStringBuilder.

fillOrCut

public FormattedStringBuilder fillOrCut(int newLength,
                                        char c)
Attempts to append c until the line gets the length newLength. If the line is already longer than newLength, then the internal strings is cut to newLength.

Parameters:
newLength - New length of the last line.
c - Character to append.
Returns:
The updated instance of FormattedStringBuilder.

fillOrCutBuffer

public FormattedStringBuilder fillOrCutBuffer(int newLength,
                                              char c)
Attempts to append c until the buffer gets the length newLength. If the buffer is already longer than newLength, then the internal strings is cut to newLength.

Parameters:
newLength - New length of the returned buffer.
c - Character to append.
Returns:
The updated instance of FormattedStringBuilder.
